reviews.content:
Customer Service is the best, quickly responds to emails and takes care of questions and solves problems. Some people say the tilt is gimmicky, it is not. You definitely feel your body weight shifting and arms pulling or pushing against the handlebar, unlike bikes that don't have incline/decline. Now that I have it, I would just keep it for how futuristic it looks in the house and the comments that I get.

It plays nice with other software, Wahoo's App is great and if you don't want to use the Bike's onboard display for gearing and tilt, just place a bike computer on the handlebar, hopefully the same one you use on your. I have the Wahoo Element Roam.

IMHO I like that the bike has no place to put your gear. If you want your gear, phone, etc.. Buy the Wahoo table, or use your own, and you can place everything on that on the side or front as you're riding.

I have another brand bike and it blocks the TV screen or Tablet since I ride with my head down with the aero bar that I attached to it. With the Wahoo, it is no problem it's like riding your bike but, w/o the wear and tear.
reviews.title: Wahoo is the The Apple of Bicycle Equipment

reviews.content:
I’ve now used the Wahoo Kickr Bike about a month now and am so far extremely happy with it. Paired with Zwift the bike works flawlessly. If I’m going uphill in the app the Kickr Bike’s front-end moves up and the peddle difficulty becomes noticeably more challenging. A descent within Zwift has the opposite noticeable effect. The bike’s operation is smooth and quite quiet. It has a myriad of position adjustments that makes sizing it to any individual rider easy to accomplish.(I purchased a spare seat post and affixed another saddle to it for my wife. When she wants to ride it I insert her seat post into the bike and swap that out when it’s my turn).

I can also tell you that I had to reach out to Wahoo’s customer service team for help to fix a broken brake handle (entirely my fault) and they couldn’t have been more accommodative. 

The bike is an investment, but for me it’s paying dividends. My wife uses the bike with the Peloton app and with YouTube cycling class videos and is getting as much use and enjoyment from it as I am. What’s more, it has us both spending more time during the week exercising in other, non-cycling, ways than we had been in a while.

So if you were to ask “Is it worth it?” I can emphatically tell you that from my perspective it is.
reviews.title: Highly recommend the Wahoo Kickr Bike

reviews.content:
Awesome exercise bike! Easy to set up to use with Sufferfest. It's very quiet compared with my previous concept2 ergbike. Erg mode works very well. 

Took a bit time to get used to all the shifter buttons on the handlebars. It's apparently the same as on high end road bikes, but i wasn't used to it, so often clicked a button by accident in the beginning. But much better now, and i actually like that you can change the intensity of a workout with one of the button on the handlebars instead of using your phone.
reviews.title: Amazing bike. Very expensive, but worth it!

reviews.content: I love this Bike! I previously had a trainer that I had my road bike attached to, as much as I tried, the fit was never perfect and I was increasingly worried that over the years it would result in damage to my road bike so I made the transition to the Wahoo Kickr Bike - I LOVE IT. I have finally set it all up and my training pit and whether I am doing a session on sufferfest or doing a Zwift route, whether I am going hard, or multi-tasking and getting work done while I get a long ride in, this bike is amazing.
reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

reviews.content:
I like the adjustability of this trainer. Me and my wife can use it (she is 165 cm tall, I am 187). It is stable even with me sprinting hard. 
I changed the saddle and the tape on the handle bar. Both are low quality on such a high quality trainer.
The stock pedals are useless.
I would suggest to Wahoo to sell this product with now saddle and pedals and spend that money on a high quality handle bar tape. Overall it would be a cheaper solution for customers as both saddle and pedal preference are very personal.
Still, it is a great product and I can recommend this to all who want to train inside.

reviews.content:
For three cyclists that share a home, there is no better choice for an indoor bike.

After putting a thousand miles on a Cannondale and a Tacx Neo 2T - the stresses and abuse that poor bike was given with climbing, sprints and sweat - has been reprieved with this Kickr Bike that is adjustable for each rider - and the Kickr can take it!

Strong, rigid - shifts well, super adjustable - and the slope angle set at the bottom bracket makes all the difference in the world for climbing.
reviews.title: It's a no brainer.

reviews.content: Worth all the money and more! My wife and I both use the bike. The easy quick adjustments make daily use super easy. We also use another 27.2 seat post with my saddle for even faster adjusting between different sized riders. We honestly cannot live without this bike! I cant say enough on how pumped I am on it!!
reviews.title: Best bike I've ever had!
